required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multicenter, Single-arm Pilot Clinical Investigation Evaluating the Use of a Surface Bleeding Severity Scale (SBSS) and the Safety and Efficacy of a New Hemostatic Device in Abdominal and Orthopedic Lower Extremity Surgeries

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this pilot clinical investigation is to assess the reliability of the Surface Bleeding Severity Scale (SBSS) in a clinical setting. Secondary objectives of this clinical investigation are to collect initial data on the safety and efficacy of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in abdominal and orthopedic lower extremity surgeries.

detailed_description.textblock:
HEMOBLAST™ Bellows is intended for use in surgical procedures as an adjunct to hemostasis when control of bleeding by conventional procedures is ineffective or impractical.
This is a prospective, multicenter, single-arm pilot clinical investigation. There will be 36 subjects enrolled across 4 investigational sites.
The subjects will be followed at hospital charge and 6 weeks postoperatively.
The primary endpoint of this clinical investigation is the mean paired Kappa statistic for the assignment of SBSS scores by 2 Investigators.
Secondary endpoints of this clinical investigation consist of:
- Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis within 6 minutes of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows application;
- Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis within 10 minutes of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows application;
- Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis within 3 minutes of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows application; and
- Incidence of adverse events through final follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Paired Kappa Statistic for the Assignment of SBSS Scores by 2 Investigators
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of this clinical investigation is the mean paired Kappa statistic for the assignment of SBSS scores by 2 Investigators.

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis within 6 minutes of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows application
Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis within 10 minutes of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows application
Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis within 3 minutes of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows application
Incidence of adverse events through final follow-up

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
